name: Addon Control Panel
description:
[COLOR="DarkOrange"][COLOR="Sienna"][B]Stop logging out of the game just to change your addons![/B][/COLOR][/COLOR]

ACP adds the "Addons" button to the game's main menu (The one you get when you hit ESC). It allows you to manage your addons in game, with an interface which looks similar to the blizzard addon manager. ACP will help you deal with the "Clutter" that multi-part addons and libraries introduce by displaying your addons in logical arrangements. ACP has many features to make your addon list easy to manage, help you with missing libraries, and provide you with detailed information about each addon.
[COLOR="DarkOrange"]
[COLOR="Sienna"][B]Icon meaning:[/B][/COLOR][/COLOR]

Star: Protected addon - this addon will not be disabled when you choose disable all, also if it is not enabled when you log into the game, it will be re-enabled and you will be prompted to reload the ui.

Dk Grey Open Lock: Addon does not supply compatibility information

Lt Grey Closed Lock: Addon has provided compatibility information

Addon compatibility helps you determine if the addon supports the current version of the game that you are running. You will see further information in the tooltip for the addon, and incompatible/out of date addons will be labeled in the main addon list.
[COLOR="DarkOrange"]
[COLOR="Sienna"][B]Credits:[/B][/COLOR][/COLOR]

ACP is based on the work of 2 other projects rMCP, which is a version of MCP modified by Rophy, and MCP originally by Saien.

name: AdvancedInterfaceOptions
description:
Restores access to removed interface options in Legion and ads a CVar browser for settings galore.

We are currently covering simple options for the following:

General:

* Player Titles
* Guild Names
* Guild Titles
* Stop Auto Attack
* Attack on Assist
* Cast action keybinds on key down
* Fade Map when Moving
* Secure Ability Toggle
* Display Lua Errors
* No Debuff Filter on Target
* Reverse Cleanup Bags
* Quest sorting mode (top vs proximity)
* Select Action Cam mode

Chat:

* Remove Chat Hover Delay
* Enable Mouse Wheel Scrolling

Floating Combat Text:

* Float mode (up/down/arc)
* Energy Gains
* Auras
* Honor Gains
* Reputation
* Combo Points
* Combat State (Entering/Leaving Combat)
* Spell Mechanics
* Healing
* Absorb (Self and Target)
* Directional Scale (brings back the classic, only upwards moving text)
* Low HP/Mana

And many more via the built in CVar browser, including stuff that has never ever been exposed as an UI option by Blizzard like the violence level or the new setting that changes the distance nameplates are visible at!

Type /aio in chat or go to the Interface Options and look for AdvancedInterfaceOptions

name: CritSound
description:
plays a sound when you perform a critical hit or healing.

includes your physical damage ,spell damage, ranged damage, healing and your damage shield.

CritSound includes three mode:

1.single mode: always plays the first sound in the list.

2.sequence mode: plays the sounds in the list one by one when you perform a critical hit continually.

3.random mode: plays the sounds in the list randomly.

Use /cs or /critsound to open the controlpanel.

if you use the sequence mode, you can modify the aging time for collecting your critical hits.

you can edit CritSound.lua to delete or add sounds.

for example, in the line 5 to 11:

spell = {

            "CriticalDamage.ogg",    --first time

            "Dominating.ogg",        --second time

            "Unstoppable.ogg",        --etc.

            "Wickedsick.ogg",

            "Godlike.ogg",

},

if you want to add xxx.ogg just add it below the last sound, but don't forget to add a comma after the new lines.

from WoD, you 'must' use ogg instead of mp3.

spell = {

            "CriticalDamage.ogg",    --first time

            "Dominating.ogg",        --second time

            "Unstoppable.ogg",        --etc.

            "Wickedsick.ogg",

            "Godlike.ogg",

"xxx.ogg",

},

name: Deadly Boss Mods
description:
The ultimate encounter helper to give you fight info that's easy to process at a glance. DBM aims to focus on what's happening to you, and what YOU need to do about it.

Make sure you download correct version for game you are playing

R - Retail (Shadowlands)
WL - Wrath of the Lich King Classic
BC - Burning Crusade Classic
C - Classic Era

 [/CENTER]
 [/CENTER]
 [/CENTER]

   [CENTER]
[/CENTER]
 [SIZE=4] [FONT=verdana]DejaClassicStats provides an updated and logical display of the character stats.

[/FONT][/SIZE] [CENTER][SIZE=3][FONT=verdana][B]Features[/B][/FONT][/SIZE]
[/CENTER]
 [COLOR=#ffffff] [FONT=verdana][B]Options Overview:[/B][/FONT][/COLOR]
[LIST]
[*][FONT=verdana]Display each equipped item's level, durability, and repair cost.[/FONT]
[*][FONT=verdana]Display a quick graphical "Durability Bar" next to each equipped item.[/FONT]
[*][FONT=verdana]Display total average durability of equipped gear on your character's shirt slot.[/FONT]
[*][FONT=verdana]Display "General", "Primary", "Offense", "Defense", "Melee Enhancements", and "Spell Enhancements" stats.[/FONT][/LIST][B][FONT=verdana][B]
[COLOR=#ffffff]Default Display[/COLOR][/B][/FONT][/B][COLOR=#ffffff]

  [FONT=verdana][B]Primary:[/B][/FONT][/COLOR]
[LIST]
[*][FONT=verdana]Strength[/FONT]
[*][FONT=verdana]Agility[/FONT]
[*][FONT=verdana]Stamina[/FONT]
[*][FONT=verdana]Intellect[/FONT]
[*][FONT=verdana]Spirit[/FONT][/LIST][COLOR=#ffffff] [FONT=verdana][B]General:[/B][/FONT][/COLOR]
[LIST]
[*][COLOR=#ff0000][I][FONT=verdana]Health*[/FONT][/I][/COLOR]
[*][COLOR=#ff0000][I][FONT=verdana]Power(Mana, Energy, Rage)*[/FONT][/I][/COLOR]
[*][COLOR=#ffffff][FONT=verdana]Movement Speed[/FONT]
[/COLOR]
[*][COLOR=#ffffff][FONT=verdana]Durability[/FONT]
[/COLOR]
[*][COLOR=#ffffff][FONT=verdana]Item Slot Durability Display[/FONT]
[/COLOR]
[*][COLOR=#ffffff][FONT=verdana]Repair Cost[/FONT]
[/COLOR]
[*][COLOR=#ffffff][FONT=verdana]Item Slot Repair Cost Display[/FONT][/COLOR][/LIST][COLOR=#ffffff] [FONT=verdana][B]Offense:[/B][/FONT][/COLOR]
[LIST]
[*][FONT=verdana]Damage[/FONT]
[*][FONT=verdana]Attack Power[/FONT]
[*][FONT=verdana]Attack Speed[/FONT]
[*][FONT=verdana]Weapon DPS[/FONT][/LIST][COLOR=#ffffff] [FONT=verdana][B]Defense:[/B][/FONT][/COLOR]
[LIST]
[*][COLOR=#ffffff][FONT=verdana]Resistances(Arcane, Fire, Nature, Frost,Shadow)
[/FONT][/COLOR]
[*][COLOR=#ffffff][FONT=verdana]Armor[/FONT]
[/COLOR]
[*][COLOR=#ffffff][FONT=verdana]Dodge[/FONT][/COLOR]
[*][COLOR=#ffffff][FONT=verdana]Parry[/FONT][/COLOR]
[*][COLOR=#ffffff][FONT=verdana]Block[/FONT]
[/COLOR]
[*][COLOR=#ffffff][FONT=verdana]Defense[/FONT][/COLOR]
[*][COLOR=#ff0000][I][FONT=verdana]Crushing*[/FONT][/I][/COLOR][/LIST][COLOR=#ffffff] [B][FONT=verdana]Melee Enhancements:[/FONT][/B][/COLOR]
[LIST]
[*]Melee Hit
[*]Melee +Damage
[*]Melee Critical Strike
[*]Ranged Critical Strike[/LIST][COLOR=#ffffff] [B][FONT=verdana]Spell Enhancements:[/FONT][/B][/COLOR]
[LIST]
[*]Spell Hit
[*]Spell+Damage
[*]Spell Critical Strike
[*]+Healing
[*]MP5 (Soon™)
[*]Mana Regen Not Casting
[*]Mana Regen Casting[/LIST]  [COLOR=#ff0000][I][FONT=verdana][B]Skills(Including XP bar):*[/B][/FONT][/I][/COLOR]
[LIST]
[*][COLOR=#ff0000][I][FONT=verdana]Weapon Skills(Only skills you've learned)*[/FONT][/I][/COLOR][/LIST]  [COLOR=#ff0000][I][FONT=verdana][B]Professions(Including XP bar):*[/B][/FONT][/I][/COLOR]
[LIST]
[*][COLOR=#ff0000][I][FONT=verdana]Both primaries*[/FONT][/I][/COLOR]
[*][COLOR=#ff0000][I][FONT=verdana]Secondaries(Cooking, First Aid)*[/FONT][/I][/COLOR][/LIST]  [COLOR=#ff0000][I][FONT=verdana][B]Reputations(Including XP bar):*[/B][/FONT][/I][/COLOR]
[LIST]
[*][COLOR=#ff0000][I][FONT=verdana]Only Reputations you've established(Tracked always at top)*[/FONT][/I][/COLOR][/LIST][COLOR=#ffffff] [B][FONT=verdana][B]Item Level:[/B][/FONT][/B][/COLOR]
[LIST]
[*][COLOR=#ffffff][FONT=verdana]Item Slot Item Level Display[/FONT][/COLOR][/LIST] 
[COLOR=#ffffff][FONT=verdana][B]Installation and Use of DejaClassicStats[/B][/FONT][/COLOR]

[COLOR=#ffffff] [FONT=verdana][B]Installation:[/B][/FONT][/COLOR]
[LIST]
[*][FONT=verdana]Install to your "AddOns" folder (World of Warcraft\Interface\AddOns) and login to WoW.[/FONT][/LIST][COLOR=#ffffff][FONT=verdana] [B]Interface Options Settings[/B][/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#ffffff]  [FONT=verdana][B]Item Slots:[/B][/FONT][/COLOR]
[LIST]
[*][FONT=verdana][COLOR=#ffffff][B]Item Level:[/B][/COLOR] Displays the item level of each equipped item.[/FONT]
[*][FONT=verdana][COLOR=#ffffff][B]Durability Bars:[/B][/COLOR] Displays a durability bar next to each item with less than 100% durability for a quick visual reference.[/FONT]
[*][FONT=verdana][COLOR=#ffffff][B]Average Durability:[/B][/COLOR] Displays on the character shirt slot the total average durability of all equipped gear.[/FONT]
[*][FONT=verdana][COLOR=#ffffff][B]Item Durability:[/B][/COLOR] Displays a durability overlay on each equipped item's slot.[/FONT]
[*][FONT=verdana][COLOR=#ffffff][B]Item Repair Cost:[/B][/COLOR] Displays an overlay of the Repair Total on each equipped item's slot.[/FONT][/LIST]
  [IMG]https://cdn-wow.mmoui.com/preview/pvw71788.png[/IMG]
[COLOR=#ffffff]  [FONT=verdana][B]Slash Commands:[/B][/FONT][/COLOR]
[LIST]
[*][FONT=verdana]/dcstats: Displays the DejaClassicStats version and slash commands.[/FONT]
[*][FONT=verdana]/dcstats config: Opens the DejaClassicStats addon config menu.[/FONT]
[*][FONT=verdana]/dcstats reset: Resets DejaClassicStats options to default. 
[/FONT][/LIST][COLOR=#ffffff][FONT=verdana][B]Known Issues:[/B][/FONT][/COLOR]
[LIST]
[*][FONT=verdana]Repair costs doesn't show on login but shows otherwise on UI reload.[/FONT][/LIST][COLOR=#ffffff] [FONT=verdana][B]TODO:[/B][/FONT][/COLOR]
[LIST]
[*][FONT=verdana]Too much to list. This is a WIP. This will be updated as we remember and come across more stats we want to track.[/FONT][/LIST][COLOR=#ffffff] [FONT=verdana][B]Future Possibilities:[/B][/FONT][/COLOR]
[LIST]
[*][FONT=verdana]Tons! Send us suggestions [URL="https://www.curseforge.com/wow/addons/dejacharacterstats/issues"]here[/URL].[/FONT][/LIST] 
[FONT=verdana]Found an error or bug? Reporting them by making a ticket [URL="https://www.curseforge.com/wow/addons/dejaclassicstats/issues"]here[/URL] after following [URL="https://phanx.net/addons/help"]these[/URL] steps makes fixing errors faster. Thanks!
[/FONT]
 [COLOR=#ffffff][FONT=verdana][B]We would like to thank everyone that helped make DCS possible.[/B][/FONT][/COLOR]

name: Fishing Buddy
description:
Fishing Buddy
-------------

 Yet another fishing support add-on.

Support thread: [URL=http://www.wowinterface.com/forums/showthread.php?t=1951]Fishing Buddy[/URL] 

 Features:
 - 'Fish Watcher' lets you see the fish you've caught here before (or
   the fish that you've caught in the current session)
 - Display your current skill level and the time since you started fishing
 - Choose your fishing outfit and change into it easily
 - Support for automatically adding a lure to your fishing pole
 - Full Titan Panel support
 - myAddOns support
 - Preliminary support for tracking 'cycle fish' such as the Nightfin
   Snapper so you know when to go looking for them

 Example commands:
 /fishingbuddy or /fb
 toggle the display of the Fishing Buddy window
 /fb help
 print the list of Fishing Buddy commands 
 /fb switch
 wear your chosen fishing outfit, or change back

 There are two actual add-ons -- the second one, OutfitDisplayFrame,
 handles the pretty pane to set up your fishing outfit (it's next on
 the list to be made into something more general that anyone can use).
 The OutfitDisplayFrame addon can be safely left out if you have a
 preferred equipment manager.

 alt-clicking on an item in your outfit display will clear it

 Silly stuff:
 In addition to displaying the fishing bonus for your fishing outfit,
 it also displays your 'style points' as inferred from [URL=http://wow.toshimo.com/viewtopic.php?t=272]Draznar's Fishing FAQ[/URL] 
Updated from duplicate postin: [url=http://www.curse-gaming.com/en/wow/addons-2111-1-fishing-buddy.html]HERE[/url]. 
Check there for updates if this falls behind.

 Thanks to the authors of:

 TackleBox -- still adding cool features to keep up with!
 Impp's Fishing DB
 QuickWeaponSwap

 and many, many others!

 Feel free to send comments to Sutorix on the Windrunner server.

Installation
------------

1. Unzip the 'FishingBuddyVERSION.zip' file
2. If your unzip program allows you to specify a location, then
   unzip it into the "Interface/AddOns" folder contained in your
   WoW folder (the location that WoW was installed)
3. If your unzip program doesn't let you specify the destination,
   then find your WoW folder (where it was installed) and drag
   the 'FishingBuddy' and 'OutfitDisplayFrame' folder into the
   'Interface/AddOns' folder.

name: Fizzle
description:
[U][B]Fizzle[/B][/U]

[I]Description[/I]
Fizzle is an addon that will show you an items durability values above the item in your character frame.
It can show you either the raw values, or a percentage value.
Why Fizzle?  Well, I suck at coming up with names is why. :)

[I]Slash Commands[/I]
[I]/fizzle[/I] or [I]/fizz[/I]
[list][*]percent - Toggle between raw and percentage display.
[*]border - Toggles the quality colours on the border of items.
[*]invert - Changes how the durability is shown.  Eg. 0% = Max durability, 100% = No durability.
[*]hidetext - Hides the durability text, incase you just want the item quality colouring.
[*]showfull - Toggles showing durability when full.  If enabled, durability text is always shown, if disabled, durability text is only shown if durability is less than 100%
[*]inspect - Toggles the inspection module.[/list]

name: HandyNotes
description:
Handy Notes for your maps. This addon is intended to be a small and simple replacement for Cartographer_Notes and functions in a similar manner.

Use /handynotes to access options.

You can add notes to the maps in 3 ways:

[LIST]
[*]Alt-RightClick on the world map to add a note.
[*]Use "/hnnew" without the quotes to add a note at your current location.
[*]Use "/hnnew x,y" without the quotes to add a note at location x,y on your current zone's map. 
[/LIST]

See change log tab for changes from v1.1.6 to v1.2.0

HandyNotes supports plugins that other authors can write to display their own set of notes on the map. See this link for a list of such addons

[URL="http://www.wowace.com/search/?search=handynotes"]http://www.wowace.com/search/?search=handynotes[/URL]

name: Mapster
description:
Mapster is a very simple world map enhacement addon, which was designed to work in conjunction with all other map addons out there. The idea to create Mapster originated from pure lack of a simplistic addon that only modifies the world map, without adding a full scale feature set.

[B]Features[/B]
[LIST]
[*]Map Style (Scale & Alpha)
[*]Coordinates
[*]Fog of War removal
[*]Enhancement of the raid/party group icons
[/LIST]

You can access the Mapster configuration menu through the new button on the world map, as shown in the screenshot. 
All features (except the style) can be turned off individually if you do not need/want them.

[I]If you're looking for a replacement to Cartographer, i also recommend the following addons:[/I][LIST][*][B]Gathering[/B] -> GatherMate (Hosted on WoWAce -> [URL="http://www.wowace.com/projects/gather-mate/"]Download[/URL]) 
[*][B]Waypoints[/B] -> [URL="http://www.wowinterface.com/downloads/info7032-TomTom.html"]TomTom[/URL]
[*][B]ZoneInfo[/B] -> [URL="http://mods.curse.com/addons/wow/cromulent"]Cromulent[/URL]
[*][B]Notes[/B] -> [URL="http://mods.curse.com/addons/wow/handynotes"]HandyNotes[/URL] | [URL="http://mods.curse.com/search?search=handynotes"]HandyNotes Modules[/URL]
[/LIST]

name: Prat 3.0
description:
Prat is a chat addon framework, and collection. It consists of 30+ modules which each add some functionality to the WoW chat interface. There is literally a module for just about everything chat related. While large in size, i have been working to keep the runtime memory usage down, and eliminate the costs of the unused modules without littering the addon directory with a slew of folders.

For the options menu, type "/prat", or if you have a broker host mod installed you will get a launcher icon.

You control the load behavior of modules via the module control screen. You have 3 choices "Don't load", "Disabled", and "Enabled"

You can report any bugs you find here:

http://www.wowace.com/projects/prat-3-0/tickets/


Prat has just about every feature you can think of, and then some. Really. When I get some more time, I'll try and put together a full list (Even I have lost count)

(Thanks to Dreamsight for this partial list)

    * Change arrows, buttons, mouse scroll for chat scroll, scroll speed
    * you can add color per channel, color per lvl, color per class
    * timestamps
    * timestamp color
    * whether to show timestamp (what format the timestamp should be in)
    * whether to show players lvl
    * you can select the option for channel "stickys" (last channel you used you auto use when hitting enter, that sort of thing – or last thing someone said)
    * change the looks of the chat's editbox - as well as where it appears (you can even undock it and move it to where you'd like it to be)
    * chat fading, fading delay
    * You can change the font to a list of fonts, add an outline to it, monochrome it (if you don’t mind messing with files a bit you could prolly even add other fonts to that list)
    * change the chat frame/chat box appearance
    * set Chat history
    * set channel abbreviations
    * set brackets and color(or something instead of brackets)round player/lvl
    * alt invite option (press keyboard “alt” button and click on the player’s name to auto inv them)
    * raid icon
    * invite links
    * info keeping
    * url copying
    * full chat copying + options (html,bbcode, plain, forum) + copy button
    * allows pop-up msgs
    * enables tell target /tt
    * Alias options
    * altnames options
    * you can enable/disable all prat modules - dont have to have the ones you dont use running
    * change chat sounds (incoming and outgoing as well as per channel
    * acheivement info, and clickable links to say "grats"


For those interested:

There is an additional folder Prat-3.0_HighCPUUsageModules.

Note: These features use CPU, so they have been placed in a special folder so that is 100% clear.

name: Quartz - Modular Casting Bar
description:
Quartz is a modular approach to a casting bar addon.  An overview of (hopefully most of) the modules:

[b]*Player[/b]
The core of Quartz is lightweight implementation of a standard casting bar, with configurable size, text and icon positioning, and colors.
[b]*Target/Focus[/b]
Implementation of target and focus casting bars in similar fashion to the player cast bar.
[b]*Buffs[/b]
Display of target and focus buffs and debuffs as duration bars using the new API introduced in patch 2.1.
[b]*Flight[/b]
Hooks into FlightMap or InFlight to display the current flight progress on your casting bar.
[b]*Global Cooldown[/b]
Displays a tiny spark-bar to show your Global Cooldown near the cast bar.  Helpful for those who'd rather not squint at their action bars to see when they can cast again.
[b]*Interrupt[/b]
Changes the color and text of your casting bar to help show that your cast has been interrupted (and show who interrupted it).
[b]*Latency[/b]
Displays the amount of time spent between cast send and start events, in the form of a bar at the end of your casting bar, with optional text that displays the actual duration of the lag.  This helps in canceling casts when they will not actually be interrupted, especially for users with consistently high pings.
[b]*Mirror[/b]
Shows the 'basic' timers such as breath and feign death, as well as some 'odd' ones such as party invite time, resurrect timeout, and arena game start, and a framework for injecting custom timers into the bars.
[b]*Range[/b]
Recolors the casting bar when your cast target moves out of range mid-cast.
[b]*Swing[/b]
Displays a swing timer for your melee weapon as well as hunter autoshot.
[b]*Timer[/b]
Allows for creating custom timers displayed on the mirror bars.
[b]*Tradeskill Merge[/b]
Merges multiple casts of the same tradeskill item into one big cast bar.


Use /quartz to bring up the configuration menu.

name: Trinket Menu Classic
description:
Trinket Menu addon updated for Classic 

Not extensively tested (as I don't have trinkets yet :>) so ymmv. Please let me know of any errors

name: WIM (WoW Instant Messenger)
description:
WIM (WoW Instant Messenger) is a World of Warcraft addon which helps you to manage your whispers by making them into a classic instant messenger interface such as AIM, Yahoo and MSN. 

With game play in mind, WIM has a large array of options where you can customize how WIM interacts during different situations, such as while you are in combat or in town talking to friends or selling your crafts.

[B]Some of WIM's major features are:[/B]
-Tabbed or windowed messages
-History
-Filtering
-Fully customizable
-and more...

To keep up to date with WIM and its developement, be sure to visit [URL]http://www.wimaddon.com[/URL]. WIMAddon.com is a great place to converse with the developers and users of WIM.


*I welcome all comments and suggestions. It is the wow community which helps in creating a success.

**Special thanks to everyone who has helped me test this addon.
